agriculture-and-natural-resources.name: Agriculture and Natural Resources
agriculture-and-natural-resources.description: Careers focused on farming, plant and animal science, conservation, and natural resources management.

animal-science.name: Animal Science
animal-science.description: Professions relating to the care, breeding, and study of animals in various environments.

jobs.title: Animal Breeder
jobs.jobTasks: Select and breed animals according to characteristics, manage breeding programs, and maintain breeding records.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $39,000 to $58,000 depending on experience and specialization.
jobs.training: Associate's or bachelor's degree in animal science or related field, plus on-the-job training.

jobs.title: Animal Caretaker
jobs.jobTasks: Feed, groom, and exercise animals, clean enclosures, and monitor animal health and behavior.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $24,000 to $35,000 with higher earnings for supervisory positions.
jobs.training: High school diploma plus on-the-job training; certifications available.

jobs.title: Animal Scientist
jobs.jobTasks: Conduct research on breeding, nutrition, and production of domestic farm animals to develop efficient ways to produce animal products.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $60,000 to $85,000 with higher earnings for those with advanced degrees.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree minimum; master's or Ph.D. required for research positions.

jobs.title: Animal Trainer
jobs.jobTasks: Train animals for riding, security, performance, obedience, or assisting persons with disabilities.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $28,000 to $55,000 depending on speciality and location.
jobs.training: High school diploma plus specialized training; certification often required.

jobs.title: Veterinarian (VMD)
jobs.jobTasks: Diagnose and treat diseases and injuries in animals, perform surgeries, and advise owners on animal care.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $80,000 to $165,000 depending on specialization and practice type.
jobs.training: Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (DVM) degree from accredited college plus state licensure.

jobs.title: Zoo Veterinarian
jobs.jobTasks: Provide medical care to animals in zoos, focusing on preventive care, nutrition, and addressing specific health issues of exotic animals.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $85,000 to $170,000 with higher earnings in larger zoos.
jobs.training: Doctor of Veterinary Medicine degree with specialized training in exotic animal medicine.

jobs.title: Zoologist
jobs.jobTasks: Study animal behavior, physical characteristics, and interactions with ecosystems; may specialize in specific animal groups.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $52,000 to $85,000 with higher earnings for research positions.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree minimum; master's or Ph.D. recommended for research and academic positions.

jobs.title: Wildlife Biologist
jobs.jobTasks: Study wildlife populations, habitats, and environmental impacts; develop conservation strategies and management plans.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $50,000 to $80,000 depending on employer and experience.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree minimum; master's or Ph.D. often required for advanced positions.

jobs.title: Wildlife Control Agent
jobs.jobTasks: Manage human-wildlife conflicts, remove nuisance animals, and implement control measures in urban and rural settings.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $35,000 to $55,000 with higher earnings for supervisory positions.
jobs.training: Associate's degree or certificate in wildlife management plus state licensure requirements.

plant-science-and-gardening.name: Plant Science & Gardening
plant-science-and-gardening.description: Careers focused on the study of plants and the science and art of growing and maintaining plant life.

jobs.title: Botanist
jobs.jobTasks: Study plant structure, growth, reproduction, and biochemistry; may specialize in specific plant groups or regions.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $52,000 to $85,000 with higher earnings for research positions.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree minimum; master's or Ph.D. required for research and academic positions.

jobs.title: Crop Workers Supervisor
jobs.jobTasks: Direct and coordinate activities of agricultural workers engaged in planting, cultivating, and harvesting crops.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $42,000 to $65,000 depending on farm size and location.
jobs.training: High school diploma plus several years of work experience; associate's degree beneficial.

jobs.title: Greenhouse and Nursery Manager
jobs.jobTasks: Oversee the production of plants in greenhouses and nurseries, manage staff, and coordinate sales and distribution.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $55,000 to $85,000 depending on facility size and location.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in horticulture or related field plus experience in plant production.

jobs.title: Horticulturist
jobs.jobTasks: Study and improve cultivation techniques for fruits, vegetables, flowers, and ornamental plants.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $45,000 to $75,000 with variation by employer and specialization.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in horticulture or related field; certifications available.

jobs.title: Plant Breeder
jobs.jobTasks: Develop new plant varieties with improved characteristics such as disease resistance, yield, or flavor.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $60,000 to $95,000 with higher earnings in private industry.
jobs.training: Master's or Ph.D. in plant science, genetics, or related field.

environmental-conservation.name: Environmental Conservation
environmental-conservation.description: Careers dedicated to protecting natural resources and maintaining environmental health through science and policy.

jobs.title: Conservation Scientist
jobs.jobTasks: Manage, improve, and protect natural resources; work with landowners and governments on conservation efforts.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $50,000 to $80,000 depending on employer and experience.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in forestry, environmental science, or related field.

jobs.title: Environmental Compliance Inspector
jobs.jobTasks: Inspect facilities for compliance with environmental regulations and laws; report violations and recommend corrective actions.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $55,000 to $85,000 with higher earnings in government positions.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in environmental science or related field; certifications beneficial.

jobs.title: Environmental Disease Analyst
jobs.jobTasks: Study relationships between environmental factors and disease outbreaks; develop prevention strategies.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $60,000 to $90,000 depending on specialization and employer.
jobs.training: Master's or Ph.D. in epidemiology, environmental health, or related field.

jobs.title: Environmental Economists
jobs.jobTasks: Study economic effects of environmental policies and develop economic solutions to environmental problems.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $85,000 to $130,000 with higher earnings in consulting firms.
jobs.training: Master's or Ph.D. in economics with environmental specialization.

jobs.title: Environmental Engineer
jobs.jobTasks: Design systems and develop solutions to environmental problems such as pollution control and waste management.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $70,000 to $110,000 with variation by industry and location.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in environmental engineering; Professional Engineer license beneficial.

jobs.title: Environmental Planner
jobs.jobTasks: Develop land use plans that minimize environmental impacts; facilitate sustainable development initiatives.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $60,000 to $95,000 with higher earnings in urban areas.
jobs.training: Master's degree in environmental planning, urban planning, or related field.

jobs.title: Environmental Research Analyst
jobs.jobTasks: Collect and analyze environmental data; prepare reports and recommend environmental policies or solutions.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $55,000 to $90,000 depending on employer and experience.
jobs.training: Bachelor's or master's degree in environmental science or related field.

jobs.title: Environmental Restoration Planners
jobs.jobTasks: Design and implement projects to restore damaged ecosystems and habitats to their natural state.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $58,000 to $92,000 with higher earnings for project managers.
jobs.training: Bachelor's or master's degree in ecology, environmental science, or related field.

jobs.title: Environmental Technician
jobs.jobTasks: Collect samples and perform laboratory tests to monitor environmental conditions and identify pollutants.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $38,000 to $58,000 depending on experience and specialization.
jobs.training: Associate's degree in environmental science or related field; certifications beneficial.

jobs.title: Soil Conservation Technician
jobs.jobTasks: Implement soil conservation practices; provide technical assistance to landowners on soil management.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $42,000 to $65,000 with variation by region and employer.
jobs.training: Associate's degree in soil science, agriculture, or related field.

jobs.title: Soil Conservationist
jobs.jobTasks: Develop and implement programs for soil erosion control, watershed protection, and sustainable land use.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $50,000 to $80,000 with higher earnings in federal agencies.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in soil science, agronomy, or related field.

jobs.title: Soil Engineer
jobs.jobTasks: Analyze soil properties for construction projects; design foundations and earthworks based on soil conditions.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $70,000 to $110,000 with higher earnings in consulting firms.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in civil or geotechnical engineering; Professional Engineer license required.

jobs.title: Soil Scientist
jobs.jobTasks: Study soil composition, classification, and properties; research soil-plant relationships and land use applications.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $52,000 to $85,000 with higher earnings in research positions.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree minimum; master's or Ph.D. for research and academic positions.

aquatic-science.name: Aquatic Science
aquatic-science.description: Careers focused on the study and management of aquatic ecosystems, marine life, and water resources.

jobs.title: Aquaculture Specialist
jobs.jobTasks: Manage the breeding, raising, and harvesting of aquatic plants and animals in controlled environments.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $48,000 to $80,000 depending on facility size and responsibilities.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in aquaculture, fisheries science, or related field.

jobs.title: Marine and Aquatic Biologist
jobs.jobTasks: Study organisms living in freshwater and marine environments; research ecosystem dynamics and environmental impacts.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $52,000 to $85,000 with higher earnings for research positions.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree minimum; master's or Ph.D. for research and academic positions.

jobs.title: Marine Surveyor
jobs.jobTasks: Inspect vessels for damage, seaworthiness, and compliance with regulations; estimate repair costs.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $60,000 to $100,000 depending on specialization and location.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in marine engineering or related field; professional certification required.

jobs.title: Oceanographer
jobs.jobTasks: Study physical, chemical, geological, and biological aspects of oceans; research ocean currents, climate, and marine life.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $70,000 to $110,000 with higher earnings for specialized research.
jobs.training: Master's or Ph.D. in oceanography or related field.

farming-and-ranching.name: Farming & Ranching
farming-and-ranching.description: Careers involved in agricultural production, livestock management, and farm operations.

jobs.title: Farm and Ranch Manager
jobs.jobTasks: Direct and coordinate activities of agricultural operations; plan crop production, livestock management, and equipment maintenance.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $55,000 to $90,000 depending on operation size and location.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in agriculture or business plus experience; some positions require only experience.

jobs.title: Farm Equipment Mechanic
jobs.jobTasks: Maintain, diagnose, and repair agricultural machinery and equipment; perform preventive maintenance.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $38,000 to $58,000 with higher earnings for specialized skills.
jobs.training: Technical school certificate or diploma in diesel or agricultural mechanics.

jobs.title: Farm Management Advisor
jobs.jobTasks: Advise farmers on business operations, financial planning, crop management, and agricultural technologies.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $60,000 to $95,000 depending on region and experience.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in agricultural economics, farm management, or related field.

jobs.title: Farm Product Buyer
jobs.jobTasks: Purchase farm products for processing, resale, or consumption; negotiate prices and terms with producers.
jobs.earningsDetails: Annual median salary ranges from $55,000 to $85,000 with variation by industry and region.
jobs.training: Bachelor's degree in agriculture, business, or related field plus industry experience.
